com.topjohnwu.superuser

Class Shell.Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topjohnwu.superuser.Shell.Config
  • Enclosing class:
    Shell

    public static final class Shell.Config
extends Object
    Static methods for configuring the behavior of Shell.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getFlags

        public static int getFlags()
        Get the flags that controls how Shell works and how a new Shell will be constructed.
        Returns:
        the flags

      • newContainer

        public static Shell.Container newContainer()
        Construct a container object. This method will automatically register the returned object to be the global container by calling setContainer(Shell.Container). The developer will only need to assign the returned value into a field of the target class.
        Returns:
        an implementation of Shell.Container.

      • setContainer

        public static void setContainer(Shell.Container container)
        Set the container to store the global Shell instance.

        Future shell commands using static method APIs will automatically obtain a Shell from the container with Shell.getShell() or Shell.getShell(GetShellCallback).

        A WeakReference of the registered container would be saved statically so the container could be garbage collected to prevent memory leak if you decide to store Shell in places like Activity.

        Parameters:
        container - the container to store the global Shell instance.

      • setFlags

        public static void setFlags(int flags)
        Set flags that controls how Shell works and how a new Shell will be constructed.
        Parameters:
        flags - the desired flags. Value is either 0 or bitwise-or'd value of Shell.FLAG_NON_ROOT_SHELL, Shell.FLAG_VERBOSE_LOGGING, Shell.FLAG_MOUNT_MASTER, or Shell.FLAG_REDIRECT_STDERR

      • setInitializer

        public static void setInitializer(Class<? extends Shell.Initializer> init)
        Set a desired Initializer.
        Parameters:
        init - the class of the desired initializer. If it is a nested class, it MUST be a static nested class!!
        See Also:
        Shell.Initializer

      • verboseLogging

        public static void verboseLogging(boolean verbose)
        Set whether enable verbose logging.

        This is just a handy function to toggle verbose logging with a boolean value. For example: Shell.verboseLogging(BuildConfig.DEBUG).

        Parameters:
        verbose - if true, add Shell.FLAG_VERBOSE_LOGGING to flags.
